info.title: Gmail API Semantic Search Enhancement Overlay

update.description: The Gmail API lets you view and manage Gmail mailbox data like threads, messages (emails), and labels.
Lists the messages in the user's mailbox. Search, find, browse, query, list, or discover email messages with filtering options. Use for inbox management, email search, and message discovery.

Sends the specified message to the recipients in the `To`, `Cc`, and `Bcc` headers. Send, transmit, deliver, dispatch, or forward an email to one or more recipients. For example usage, see [Sending email](https://developers.google.com/gmail/api/guides/sending).
Gets the specified message. Retrieve, read, open, fetch, view, or access a specific email from the user's mailbox. Returns message content, headers, and metadata.
Immediately and permanently deletes the specified message. This operation cannot be undone. Prefer `messages.trash` instead. Permanently remove, purge, or erase an email with no recovery option.
Modifies the labels on the specified message. Add, remove, update, change, or manage labels on an email. Use to organize email, mark as read/unread, star/unstar, or apply custom labels.
Moves the specified message to the trash. Delete, remove, discard, or move an email to trash folder. Soft delete that can be undone with untrash operation.
Removes the specified message from the trash. Restore, recover, undelete, or retrieve an email from trash folder back to the inbox or original location.
